title: Ticket #7133: condor_master should not abort when it is not in the DAEMON_LIST
description:
When the condor_master does not find itself in the DAEMON_LIST it will refuse to start. This behavior was intended once apon a time, but it makes no sense in the current universe.

Also, when the DAEMON_LIST is empty, the condor_master has ancient code to use a default daemon list of MASTER STARTD SCHEDD. This may have made sense at one time, but it no longer does, and in any case, since this list does not contain SHARED_PORT nothing starts up correctly. In this case, the master treats ALL known daemon core daemons as startable (via condor_on)

The condor_master will be changed so that it automatically inserts itself into the daemon list if needed, and if the list is empty, it will start only itself and SHARED_PORT and treat only COLLECTOR NEGOTIATOR STARTD SCHEDD as startable.
